title: Jobert Richie Nansseu
text: Jobert Richie Nansseu is a Cameroonian epidemiologist and Public Health expert. He is known for his research and work in the areas of infectious diseases, maternal and child health, non-communicable diseases, and health systems strengthening. JRN has contributed to more than 120 scientific publications and has been actively involved in public health initiatives in Cameroon and beyond. He has also served in various academic and advisory roles, helping to shape health policies and improve healthcare delivery in resource-limited settings. He has served as international consultant for many International Organizations including WHO. He is also a PhD Student in Epidemiology/Public Health at the Faculty of Medicine and Biomedical Sciences of the University of Yaoundé I in Cameroon.

title: Analysis of Cameroon DHS data for 2018
text: This analysis shows the prevalence and associated factors of HIV among women living in Cameroon, based on its latest (2018) Demographic and Health Survey data. This report can be found here
